author.persName: Mirzā Muḥammad Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad ʻAlī
مرزا محمد حسن بن محمد علي

msItem.title: Mirʼāt-i Aḥmadī
مرآت احمدي
msItem.note: Folio one, recto: a) in red ink probably by the original rubricator: al-juz-i awwal-i [sic] tawarikh-i mir'at-i ahmadi, 'part one of the histories of the Mir'at-i Ahmadi'. b)stamp with name written in: Presented to the ROYAL ASIATIC SOCIETY by John Romer Esq. By the sane scribe as Nos 83 and 84, and uniformly bound. The set was made for John Romer. The author's name does not seem to appear in the introductory passage, but is given in the colophon of No 83. A History of Gujarat, from the origin of the kingdom to A.H. 1174. This MS contains the first part of the work, to A.H. 1131, ending with events of A.H. 1131 / A.D. 1719. Scribe was Shiv La'l sone of Sundar La'l Nakir? Ahmadabadi, resident in Surat. See colophons of Nos 83 and 84. Written for John Romer, 'Sardar' of Surat. See colophons of Nos 83 and 84. Headings and punctuation in red.
msItem.incipit: Fihris-i nuskhah-i daftar-i kull-i hamd-i padshah-i malik al-mulki

listBibl.bibl: For the provenance see Donations Register for November 18 1848.

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather Oriental binding with blind-stamped decoration.

origin.p: Surat. C. A.H. 1234/A.D.1819, the date of the colophon of the second volume (No. 83).

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
